title: Selector-Registry-Driven Steps (no data-testid assumptions)
description: Refactor the step execution layer to resolve elements via the selector registry and robust heuristics instead of assuming data-testids, so the framework works on arbitrary apps without HTML changes.
acceptance_criteria:
- Steps run on an app with no data-testid attributes and pass using the selector registry + heuristics.
- Existing projects with data-testid keep working without change.
- Pluggable strategy order (role/label/name/css/testid) via config/env.
- Selector usage is auditable via logs; CI verifies referenced selector IDs or heuristic fallbacks.
- README/docs updated with usage and migration notes.

title: Docs: selector-driven steps + migration guide
description:
Document the new selector resolution behavior and migration path:
- How to use the selector registry and strategy env var.
- How to add/curate registry entries.
- Examples for apps with no data-testids.
- Notes about CI verification and logging.
acceptance_criteria:
- README + docs/development updated with a dedicated section.
- Example snippets for common selectors (role, label, name, css).
- Link from Quick Start and Troubleshooting.

title: Stagehand-centric E2E Authoring (no clarifications)
description: Design and implement a Stagehand-first pipeline replacing YAML/clarifications; deterministic CI; CLI now, UI later.

title: Refactor step definitions to use selector resolver
description:
Rewrite `navigation.steps.ts`, `interaction.steps.ts`, and `assertion.steps.ts` so they:
- Use the new `selectorResolver` to find elements.
- Accept both literal strings and placeholder tokens `<ENV_KEY>`.
- Support optional per-step selector ID hints if present in compiled metadata.
- Keep backward compatibility where registry IDs resolve to testid if available.
acceptance_criteria:
- Existing feature files run unchanged on an app without data-testid using labels/name.
- Steps log which selector strategy matched.
- No hard-coded `[data-testid=...]` remains in step code.

title: Stagehand-centric E2E Authoring (no clarifications)
description: Design and implement a Stagehand-first pipeline replacing YAML/clarifications; deterministic CI; CLI now, UI later.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text: Scope decision: remove clarifications step entirely. Authoring flows use Stagehand sessions to derive Action Graph; compiler emits deterministic tests; CI never calls LLM.

title: CI gating and deterministic policy
description: Block Stagehand in CI; ensure cached/compiled tests only; add pipeline checks.
notes: Implemented the CI policy guard script (`tests/scripts/ci-policy.ts`) plus `ci:policy`/`pretest` hooks and documentation so CI jobs fail fast when Stagehand authoring mode, mock login, or missing compiled artifacts would violate the deterministic policy. Guard checks `tests/normalized/`, `tests/features/`, and `tests/steps/generated/` before allowing `yarn test` to run.

title: Minimal HTTP API for future UI
description: Expose /sessions, /compile, /run; file-backed jobs; stream logs.

title: Replace legacy LLM pipeline; remove clarifications
description: Remove clarifications/normalize steps; migrate docs and scripts; keep Playwright runner.

title: OpenRouter provider wiring (authoring only)
description: Configure provider/model and keys; document costs; no CI dependency.

title: Provenance ledger (.ndjson) + cost metrics
description: Append per action/test: tokens, duration, cache hits, hashes; redact secrets.

title: Spike: record→compile→run a login flow
description: Deliver end-to-end demo with deterministic CI replay and documented steps.
notes:
Outcome: E2E spike validated. Root cause of prior failures was sandboxed environment blocking local sockets (CODEX_SANDBOX_NETWORK_DISABLED=1), causing Chromium startup to abort. Workaround validated by running Playwright with network enabled (local sockets only). Evidence: 1) Smoke test passed. 2) Generated BDD login scenario passed with MOCK_LOGIN_APP=true.

Key changes:
- Added configurable launch toggles in `playwright.config.ts`:
  - `PW_EXTRA_CHROME_ARGS`, `PW_IGNORE_NO_SANDBOX`, `PW_CHROME_PATH`, `PW_CHANNEL`.
- Confirmed mock login app wiring via `tests/fixtures/stagehand-bdd.js` works.
- Verified generated artifacts run: `tests/features/compiled/...authenticate-with-valid-credentials.feature` + matching steps.

How to run locally (non-sandbox):
- `MOCK_LOGIN_APP=true yarn test` (uses bundled Chromium)
- If needed: `PW_CHROME_PATH=/path/to/chrome MOCK_LOGIN_APP=true yarn test`
- If distro supports SUID sandbox: `PW_IGNORE_NO_SANDBOX=true MOCK_LOGIN_APP=true yarn test`

CI note:
- Keep Stagehand/LLM off in CI; run compiled tests only. In strict sandboxes without sockets, use a compile-only job or run browser tests on a runner where local sockets are allowed.

Acceptance (met): record→compile→run demo passes headless and is documented; deterministic replay uses mock app.

title: Stagehand runtime wrapper over Playwright
description: Wrap Playwright page/session to expose observe/act/extract with caching and policy guards.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text: Implemented authoring-mode guards; fixed Stagehand import/types; added Playwright decorator `withStagehand(page)` to attach observe/act/extract. Wrapper now enforces deterministic CI (blocks live LLM calls when `authoringMode=false` in CI) and caches results via `StagehandCache`.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text:
Unit-tested Stagehand wrapper and CI policy guards. Summary:

- Added authoring guards in observe/act/extract; blocks uncached calls in CI unless authoringMode=true.
- Fixed import/types to use Stagehand v3 directly.
- Exposed Playwright decorator: withStagehand(page).
- Wrote focused unit tests using local Stagehand mock; no browser/LLM network.

Files:
- tests/scripts/stagehand/wrapper.ts
- tests/scripts/stagehand/index.ts
- tests/scripts/stagehand/types.ts (type-only Playwright import)
- tests/mocks/node_modules/@browserbasehq/stagehand/index.js (mock)
- tests/mocks/register-stagehand-mock.js (runtime hook)
- tests/unit/stagehand-wrapper.test.ts (unit tests)
- tsconfig.unit.json (unit build config)

How to run locally:
- PLAYWRIGHT_SKIP_BROWSER_DOWNLOAD=1 npm ci
- ./node_modules/.bin/tsc -p tsconfig.unit.json
- NODE_PATH=tests/mocks/node_modules:node_modules node --require ./tests/mocks/register-stagehand-mock.js dist-unit/unit/stagehand-wrapper.test.js

All tests passed on Nov 8, 2025.

title: Define Action Graph schema + persistence
description: Design typed nodes, I/O format, and write/read to artifacts/graph/*.json with versioning.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text:
2025-11-09 code review findings:
- Deleted tests/__tests__ regression suites → no coverage for normalize/collect/questions/etc.
- GraphPersistence indexes graphs only by specId; any second scenario overwrites read() results.
- yamlToActionGraph leaves every node type as act, drops testData, disconnects background nodes, and infers authorship via llmProvider=='cli'.
- Schema $id points at cazino-frontend.com which we do not own.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text: Implemented action-graph fixes: restored regression suites, expanded builder to capture background sequencing + testData + authorship, and renamed persistence files per spec+scenario with new schema coverage. tsc + unit suites now pass.

title: Compiler: Action Graph → Gherkin + step defs
description: Generate .feature and deterministic Playwright steps; no Stagehand in runtime.

title: Selector registry + drift validator
description: Single source of selectors with verification and suggested updates; artifacts/selectors/registry.json.

title: Umbrella CLI 'bdd' (init, record, compile, run, verify)
description: Single entrypoint mapping to services; friendly output and non-zero exit codes.

title: Stagehand cache + authoring/CI policy toggles
description: Enable STAGEHAND_CACHE_DIR and AUTHORING_MODE env flags; enforce CI LLM-off.

comments.author: benji822
comments.text: Wired StagehandWrapper defaults to STAGEHAND_CACHE_DIR/AUTHORING_MODE, tightened CI guard messaging, extended tests, and documented the new env toggles.

title: Expose selector hints from compiler to generated specs
description:
Emit per-step selector ID hints into generated artifacts so runtime step code can resolve exact elements:
- Add selector ID(s) to `bddFileData` or as inline comments in generated spec wrappers.
- Plumb through action-graph node.selector IDs → feature → spec wrapper.
- Ensure hints are optional; resolver falls back to heuristics when absent.
acceptance_criteria:
- Generated spec wrapper includes selector IDs for steps that referenced selectors during recording.
- Step layer can read these IDs during execution.
- If IDs are missing, tests still pass using resolver heuristics.

title: Selector validation and CI guard updates
description:
Update `validate-selectors` and `spec:ci-verify` so they:
- Report which steps rely on registry IDs vs. heuristics.
- Fail when zero strategies match (clear error message + hint to add a registry entry).
- Optionally enforce a minimum stability/priority for matched selectors via config.
acceptance_criteria:
- CI bundle includes a selectors usage report per step.
- `yarn bdd verify` fails with actionable messages when selectors are missing.
- Configurable policy for allowed strategies (e.g., role/label only).

title: Selector resolver + registry loader utility
description:
Introduce a `selectorResolver(page, idOrHint, options)` that:
- Loads `tests/artifacts/selectors/registry.json` once and caches it.
- Supports lookup by selector ID (exact), or by hint tokens such as `email`/`password` when no ID is provided.
- Resolves to a Playwright locator using a strategy chain: role → label → name attribute → placeholder → CSS → testid (configurable order).
- Exposes telemetry (which strategy matched) for audit.
acceptance_criteria:
- Given a minimal HTML without data-testid, resolver can fill email/password by label or name.
- Resolver returns a `Locator` and logs `{strategy, selector}`.
- Fallback order can be changed via env `SELECTOR_STRATEGY=role,label,name,placeholder,css,testid`.
